description: yellow glaze; largest of graduated set; globular; small rounded handle at top center; horizontal line across body; a few incised designs at top half and a series of incised designs at bottom half
medium: High-fired stoneware with stamped decor under a light yellow-green glaze
text: The exact name and purpose of these works are controversial. Most excavation reports identify objects like these as <I>ch'uan<I>, a type of bronze measure. Other scholars believe them to be modeled on a type of bronze musical instrument, which was suspended as bells in graduated sets and struck on the exterior to create music. No matter what they replicate, this set has no practical function and should be seen purely as funerary ware for the afterlife.
title: Ch'uan, one of a set of seven
